meanings.definition: A person with uncultivated or uncultured tastes or interests.
meanings.sent1: The party was full of lowbrows who only wanted to watch reality TV.
meanings.sent2: She felt out of place at the art gallery surrounded by lowbrows.
meanings.sent3: The lowbrows at the movie theater laughed loudly at all the wrong moments.
meanings.sent4: His colleagues considered him a lowbrow for his love of cheesy action movies.
meanings.sent5: The lowbrows in the book club always picked the easiest reads.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to people with uncultivated or uncultured tastes or interests.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant played lowbrows music to attract a younger crowd.
meanings.sent2: Her lowbrows fashion sense clashed with the elegant event's dress code.
meanings.sent3: The museum curator found the lowbrows painting oddly charming.
meanings.sent4: The highbrow critics dismissed the film as lowbrows entertainment.
meanings.sent5: The lowbrows magazine featured gossip and celebrity news.
